ygData.subject: Re: Digest Number 39
ygData.msgSnippet: Get a cleric to heal the monster he s fighting (especially if he is a solo jerk).  Buff the monster he is fighting...there are more things that can be done but
ygData.messageBody:
Get a cleric to heal the monster he's fighting (especially if he is a solo jerk). Buff the monster he is fighting...there are more things that can be done but these are a couple of the most obvious.


> ** Original Subject: Re: [warriors_eq] Digest Number 39
> ** Original Sender: Morix@...
> ** Original Date: Thu, 27 May 1999 05:24:25 EDT

> ** Original Message follows...

>
> From: Morix@...
>
> >Mostly I am a lurker on this list...10th Dwarves Warrior, Ironore on Eci'i
> >
> >Got to agree with a previous poster about the huge amounts of mail that come
> >in on this list, it gets a bit much. And the digest mode is just about
> >useless, as everyone who RE:'s keeps including the full text from the
> >previous poster, resulting in literally 100's of lines of text per email.
> >Is it really necessary to include the full body of the 10 previous responses
> >to a post in an post that doesn't even address the subject anymore?
> >
> >Sorry for the criticism, I do get a lot out of this list and hope to be able
> >to contribute to it as I level up.
>
> Definite agreement there. What really irks me is when someone quotes a whole
> digest in their post. Cut-and-paste is NOT a difficult process, people. 90%
> of the time these digests I get are too big to be read online and I have to
> download them. Of course then I often don't have the time to go back and
> read it or I just forget its there.
>
> But onto other warrior-related topics: I have a story that led to a
> particularly interesting problem. Currently I am an 8th lvl warrior on
> Cazic-Thule who adventures around the Freeport environs: Desert of Ro,
> Commonlands, et al. One day in the desert this nasty little dark elf
> shadowknight has hanging around and this guy is a known kill-stealer and a
> real jerk (anyone who frequents the desert *might* know who I'm t/*alking
> about). He was hanging around our party making rude gestures at us and
> calling us really nasty names. Then he seemed to go away. A little while
> later I spotted him fighting a giant spider so I figured I'd teach him a
> little lesson. I ran over and attacked it myself, and he starts telling me
> to back off. Of course it didn't matter much because he easily defeated it
> quickly thereafter. "Oh well," I thought, "His comeuppance shall be had
> another day." I then ran over to attack an orc. Well this little pest
> followed me over and killed off the orc I was fighting, then told me that was
> my punishment for trying to steal his kill. This got me really angry. I
> wanted to challenge him to a duel but he was one level higher than I and had
> some really good armor to boot so I figured I would lose. I took a
> screenshot of him using foul language and sent a petition, but I was told by
> a GM to just work it out myself. Some verbal tennis was had between my party
> and this dark elf, but other than shooting off a few tart zingers we were
> pretty much up a creek with this guy.
>
> What is one to do in a situation like this? Has anyone else ever come across
> this kind of thing? What did you do about it?
>
> ------------------------------------------------------------------------
> With more than 17 million e-mails exchanged daily...
> http://www.onelist.com
> ....ONElist is THE place where the world talks!
> ------------------------------------------------------------------------
> For the Honor and Glory of the Warlord, Rallos Zek!


>** --------- End Original Message ----------- **

>
